direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods generate random dates based on age ranges but return different date types (Timestamp vs. LocalDate).
Both methods generate random dates within specified ranges, sharing similar control flow and parameter handling.
Both methods handle time-based calculations and may throw similar exceptions related to invalid time units or ranges.
Both methods access and manipulate time-based resources, albeit in different directions (future vs. past).
Both methods modify temporal states (dates and durations) based on input parameters.

enhanced_by.reason: Initialization of time units is required for setting up the context for date generation methods.
Setting up date ranges is necessary before generating random dates within those ranges.
Verification of date ranges is crucial for ensuring the generated dates fall within expected bounds.
